content.description: This route follows the obvious bulge/undercling up the face of the cliff. The crux is the sequence of moves right above the small roof. Topping out is part of the route!
content.protection: This can be bouldered or can be protected by a top rope using 2 trees almost directly above the route. Use long slings or static rope.
content.location: Start right below the big bulge, and head diagonally left a little and then up to the top.

content.description: This alternative start has a bouldery undercling traverse.
content.protection: Toprope off trees on top. For the starting traverse, you might want a pad, because it is far to the right of the anchor. Or boulder the whole thing.
content.location:
Start on a undercling to the far right of the original holds. Then move left, transferring to different undercling sections until you reach the start holds of Ghost Town. Then follow that to the top.

 Here are the starting holds:

content.description: Ghost Town has technical face climbing over a bulge to a small, slabby ledge.
content.protection: Toprope off trees that are slightly to the left of the route. It can be bouldered, but you would need many pads.
content.location: Start on 2 underclings, and go straight up past some roofs, following the tiny crack (unusable) to the slabby ledge.

content.description: Rail Rock is a small, 18 foot cliff. There are some good cleaned routes, but others are covered with moss. Cleaning will continue, and more routes will be added.
